extendedIngredients.name: butter
extendedIngredients.originalString: ¼ cup butter melted, plus more to butter the griddle
metaInformation: plus more to butter the griddle

extendedIngredients.name: flour
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1¾ cup all-purpose flour or more, see note

extendedIngredients.name: sweet potato
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1½ cups leftover sweet potato casserole, see our recipe here

recipes.title: Sweet Potato Pancakes
recipes.instructions: In a large bowl beat eggs with butter and milk. Stir in the sweet potato casserole. (Its OK if a little topping gets mixed in; pecans and brown sugar topping from the casserole)In a separate bowl, mix flour, brown sugar, baking powder, cinnamon and salt.Add dry to wet and stir just to combine.Preheat oven to 200 degrees to keep pancakes warm while you cook the entire batch.Heat one or two griddle pans to medium low and grease each with butter. (Make sure the pan is completely up to temperature before adding the butter)Use a quarter cup measuring cup and scoop the batter onto the pans, about four per pan. Cook until the edges start to dry and the bottom is browned then flip, about 2-3 minutes. Cook on the other side until brown and place on a cookie sheet then place the cookie sheet in the oven to keep warm while you continue to cook.While the pancakes are cooking, heat a small saut pan over medium and add the pecans. Dry toast for about five minutes until browned, tossing often. Set aside to cool and coarsely chop or leave whole.To serve, drizzle with maple syrup and top with toasted pecans.

steps.step: In a large bowl beat eggs with butter and milk. Stir in the sweet potato casserole. (Its OK if a little topping gets mixed in; pecans and brown sugar topping from the casserole)In a separate bowl, mix flour, brown sugar, baking powder, cinnamon and salt.
Add dry to wet and stir just to combine.Preheat oven to 200 degrees to keep pancakes warm while you cook the entire batch.

Heat one or two griddle pans to medium low and grease each with butter. (Make sure the pan is completely up to temperature before adding the butter)Use a quarter cup measuring cup and scoop the batter onto the pans, about four per pan. Cook until the edges start to dry and the bottom is browned then flip, about 2-3 minutes. Cook on the other side until brown and place on a cookie sheet then place the cookie sheet in the oven to keep warm while you continue to cook.While the pancakes are cooking, heat a small saut pan over medium and add the pecans. Dry toast for about five minutes until browned, tossing often. Set aside to cool and coarsely chop or leave whole.To serve, drizzle with maple syrup and top with toasted pecans.
